ags:resource.dc:title: Obsah organických látek a živin v půdě po aplikaci vybraných kondicionéru

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Content of organic compounds and nutrients content as affected by application of selected soil conditioners

dc:creator.ags:creatorCorporate: Slovak University of Agriculture, Nitra, Slovak Republic

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Effect of Agrisorb, compost, zeolite and lignite application on humic substances content, water extractable carbon and nitrogen content, and nutrients content was studied. Long-term field experiments were carried out on two Haplic Cambisols (Iocality Malonty and Námešť nad Oslavou, Czech Republic) and Arenic Regosols (Ratíškovice, Czech Republic) during the period 2008 - 2014. Selected soils were light or middle textured, with low humic substances and nutrients content, low sorption capacity, and with acid soil reaction. Results showed that compost application had the high est effect on increasing of humic substances content and quality, total nutrients content, and water extractable carbon and nitrogen content. The effect of Agrisorb, lignite and zeolite application was manifested mainly by improvement of nutrients regime. The expensiveness of soil conditioners application was decreasing in the following order: compost, Agrisorb, zeolite lignite.
